trans-unit.source: Provides User Datagram Protocol (UDP) statistical data.

Instances of this class are returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetUdpIPv4Statistics%2A> and <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetUdpIPv6Statistics%2A> methods to give applications access to UDP traffic information.
The information in this class correlates to the management information objects described in [http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2013.txt](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2013.txt).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.UdpStatistics"></xref> class.
This constructor can be called only by classes that derive from <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.UdpStatistics>.
Gets the number of User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams that were received.
The number returned by this property does not include datagrams that were received but not deliverable.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of datagrams that were delivered to UDP users.
Gets the number of User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams that were sent.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of datagrams that were sent.
Gets the number of User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams that were received and discarded because of port errors.

To find the total number of datagrams that could not be delivered, add the values that were returned by this property and the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.UdpStatistics.IncomingDatagramsWithErrors%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of received UDP datagrams that were discarded because there was no listening application at the destination port.
Gets the number of User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams that were received and discarded because of errors other than bad port information.

To find the total number of datagrams that could not be delivered, add the values that were returned by this property and the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.UdpStatistics.IncomingDatagramsDiscarded%2A> property.

An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of received UDP datagrams that could not be delivered for reasons other than the lack of an application at the destination port.
Gets the number of local endpoints that are listening for User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams.
You can use the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.UdpClient> and <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket> classes to create UDP listener applications.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of sockets that are listening for UDP datagrams.
